skill.name: executing-plans
skill.description: Use when you have a written implementation plan to execute in a separate session with review checkpoints
skill.summary: Use when you have a written implementation plan to execute in a separate session with review checkpo...
skill.author: obra

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution. Contains only SKILL.md with structured instructions for batch plan execution. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external commands detected.

content.value_statement: Complex implementation plans can lead to scope creep and missed issues. This skill provides a structured batch execution approach with mandatory review checkpoints, ensuring each phase is verified before continuing.
actual_capabilities: Load and critically review written implementation plans
Execute tasks in configurable batches with default of 3 tasks
Run verifications after each task as specified in the plan
Report progress between batches with verification output
Stop and ask for help when encountering blockers
Hand off to finishing-a-development-branch skill when complete
limitations: Requires a pre-written implementation plan to be loaded
Does not create or modify plans itself
Execution pauses at batch boundaries for human review
Cannot proceed past blockers without human intervention

use_cases.title: Architectural Implementation
use_cases.description: Execute complex feature implementations with oversight, ensuring each batch aligns with architectural vision.

use_cases.title: Phased Code Review
use_cases.description: Review implementation in chunks, providing feedback between batches before work continues.

use_cases.title: Milestone-Based Progress
use_cases.description: Track team progress through implementation milestones with clear verification at each stage.

prompt_templates.title: Start Plan Execution
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using the executing-plans skill to implement this plan. Load the plan, review it critically, and raise any concerns before we start.

prompt_templates.title: Execute First Batch
prompt_templates.prompt: Proceed with the first batch of tasks. Execute each task exactly as specified, run verifications, and report what was implemented.

prompt_templates.title: Continue After Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the feedback changes and execute the next batch of tasks. Report verification output when complete.

prompt_templates.title: Complete Development
prompt_templates.prompt: All tasks are complete and verified. Use the finishing-a-development-branch skill to present options and finalize the work.

best_practices: Always review the plan critically before starting to catch gaps early
Execute exactly as specified in the plan without adding unrequested changes
Stop immediately when blocked rather than guessing at solutions
anti_patterns: Skipping the initial plan review and diving straight into execution
Continuing past batch boundaries without waiting for feedback
Ignoring repeated verification failures and pushing forward anyway

faq.question: What if the plan has errors or gaps?
faq.answer: Stop execution immediately and raise concerns with your partner before starting. Clarify and wait for an updated plan.

faq.question: How many tasks per batch?
faq.answer: Default is 3 tasks per batch. Adjust based on task complexity and verification requirements in the plan.

faq.question: Can I skip verification steps?
faq.answer: Never skip verifications. They ensure each task is complete and working before proceeding to the next batch.

faq.question: What happens if a verification fails?
faq.answer: Stop the batch and report the failure. Ask for guidance rather than continuing or modifying the approach.

faq.question: Does this skill create plans?
faq.answer: No, this skill executes pre-written plans. Use a planning skill to create the plan before invoking this skill.

faq.question: How is this different from regular development?
faq.answer: The structured batch approach with mandatory checkpoints reduces scope creep and ensures human oversight at key milestones.
